info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:32PM EDT until July 04 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following counties, in east central Georgia, Columbia and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Edgefield and McCormick. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Martinez, Fort Gordon, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, Augusta National Golf Club, Riverwood, Summerville, Midtown, Glendale, Windy Ridge Estates, Evans Medical Center, Evans Towne Center Park, Westmont, Blanchard Park, Bellevue Memorial Gardens and Waverly. Streams that will be afffected are Cane Creek near Martinez, Reed Creek near Lamkin, North Branch of Reed Creek, Betty`s Branch, Dry Branch, Black Branch and Raes Creek. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 189 and 201. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
